info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 10:35AM AKDT until June 29 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
Recent precipitation overnight from residual onshore flow has elevated river and lake levels on Montana Creek and Auke Bay respectively. Convective training showers over the Auke Lake area and the Montana Creek basin currently occurring are expected to continue for the next few hours, causing a sharp increase in Montana Creek and Auke Lake.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Near Auke Lake and Montana Creek near areas near the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road and near Back Loop Road at the Montana Creek bridge.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly, especially near Montana Creek and Auke Lake. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 2 inches are possible.
- For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 10:00am the stage was 32.0 feet. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet.
Impacts: At 32.0 feet: This is bankful conditions along Auke Lake.
At 33.0 feet: Water from the lake will inundate yards of homes along Auke Lake.
- For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 10:00am the stage was 14.0 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.6 feet is expected around 1:00pm Sunday. Water levels will go above minor flood stage around noon Sunday.
Impacts: At 14.5 feet: Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. Bankfull conditions at the gauge with water starting to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields along Mendenhall Loop Road.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING
